DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to determine whether the Air Barrier System device reduces airborne particulate and airborne colony forming units present at a surgery site.
DOC.brief_title: Device to Reduce Surgery Site Contamination
DOC.detailed_description: The Air Barrier System is a device that uses localized clean air flow to shield a surgery site from ambient airborne contamination. This study examines the hypothesis that the Air Barrier System can reduce the presence of airborne colony-forming units (e.g. bacteria colonies) and particulate at the surgery site.
DOC.criteria: Candidate for primary total hip arthroplasty Prior history of infection Revision arthroplasty Screens positive for MRSA Undergoing hemiarthroplasty or resurfacing
DOC.keyword: Decrease in CFU density at surgery site
Decrease in airborne particulate at surgery site
